claims.text: The Earth's average surface temperature has increased by approximately 1.1Â°C since pre-industrial times
claims.reasoning: Multiple peer-reviewed studies and IPCC reports confirm climate warming with high certainty

claims.text: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius at sea level
claims.reasoning: Well-established physical property confirmed by thermodynamics

claims.text: The Eiffel Tower was completed in 1889
claims.reasoning: Historical fact well-documented in multiple reliable sources

claims.text: COVID-19 vaccines prevent severe illness and death
claims.reasoning: Numerous clinical trials and real-world data demonstrate vaccine efficacy

claims.text: The moon landing was faked by NASA
claims.reasoning: Overwhelming evidence including lunar samples, independent verification, and technological analysis contradicts this claim

claims.text: Vitamin C cures the common cold
claims.reasoning: Multiple clinical studies show vitamin C provides no cure for common cold, though may slightly reduce duration

claims.text: The human brain uses only 10% of its capacity
claims.reasoning: Neuroscience research demonstrates humans use virtually all of their brain, with most of the brain active constantly

claims.text: Python was created by Guido van Rossum in 1989
claims.reasoning: Well-documented programming language history with clear attribution and timeline

claims.text: Donald Trump was elected US President in 2016
claims.reasoning: Historical electoral fact verified by multiple sources and official records

claims.text: Joe Biden is the 46th President of the United States
claims.reasoning: Current official status verified by government records

claims.text: The Great Wall of China is visible from space with naked eye
claims.reasoning: Astronauts and satellite imagery confirm the wall is not visible without optical aids

claims.text: The Internet was invented by Tim Berners-Lee
claims.reasoning: Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web (WWW), not the Internet itself, which was developed by ARPANET and others

claims.text: The Earth is flat
claims.reasoning: Overwhelming scientific evidence including physics, satellite imagery, and observations confirms spherical Earth

claims.text: There was a major earthquake in Tokyo in 1923
claims.reasoning: Well-documented historical event with extensive records and multiple accounts

claims.text: Smartphones use more electricity than traditional phones
claims.reasoning: Smartphones require significantly more power due to processing, display, and wireless connectivity

claims.text: The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci in the 16th century
claims.reasoning: Well-established art history fact with clear documentation and analysis

claims.text: Climate change is primarily caused by human activities
claims.reasoning: IPCC and scientific consensus confirm anthropogenic climate change with high confidence

claims.text: Evolution by natural selection is a scientific theory
claims.reasoning: Evolution is the foundation of modern biology supported by extensive evidence

claims.text: The Internet was created in the 1960s
claims.reasoning: ARPANET, the precursor to modern Internet, was developed in the late 1960s

claims.text: Antibiotics can cure viral infections
claims.reasoning: Antibiotics only work against bacteria, not viruses. Antibiotic resistance is worsened by misuse

claims.text: The Titanic sank in 1912 after hitting an iceberg
claims.reasoning: Well-documented historical event with extensive records and wreck evidence

claims.text: Vaccines contain microchips that track individuals
claims.reasoning: No scientific evidence supports this claim; vaccines would be damaged by typical sterilization and storage

claims.text: Mars has been visited by human astronauts
claims.reasoning: As of 2025, only robotic rovers have explored Mars. No human missions have been completed

claims.text: The Amazon rainforest produces 20% of the world's oxygen
claims.reasoning: Estimates vary; while important, the exact percentage is debated by experts

claims.text: Artificial intelligence can pass the Turing Test
claims.reasoning: Modern AI language models can successfully fool evaluators in Turing Test scenarios
